question: Which nation's development strategy is "Belt and Road Initiative"?
explanation: The Belt and Road Initiative, also known as One Belt One Road (OBOR), is a Chinese development strategy adopted in 2013 which involves infrastructure development and investments covering 70 countries and international organisations of Asia, Africa, Europe, Middle East and America. This initiative revolves around the promotion of economic development and inter-regional connectivity. It covers the road, rail and sea routes which are synonymous with modern-day silk road.
